definition: to have one's hands tied/helpless/unable to do anything about it
surname Shu
to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
hands tied and waiting to be captured
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
hands tied and expecting the worst
hands tied and expecting the worst

sentences.english: To face the reality, we often do nothing, the flag to surrender.
sentences.chinese: 面对现实，我们常常束手无策，举旗投降。

sentences.english: It permitted individual entrepreneurs to do their own thing.
sentences.chinese: 这时私人企业便可以大有作为，不必束手束脚。

sentences.english: Modern Western medicine has had little impact in staying the disease's deadly hand.
sentences.chinese: 现代西医技术对这种疾病的死亡之手基本束手无策。

sentences.english: But then the White House staff is several steps removed from a negotiating process.
sentences.chinese: 但白宫官员随后却在谈判过程中感到了一些束手无策。

sentences.english: But Liverpool cannot afford to lose and Benítez has just described the game as the key to the rest of the season.
sentences.chinese: 但是利物浦是不会束手就擒的。

sentences.english: To eschew such tools is to fight terrorism with one hand tied behind your back.
sentences.chinese: 而一旦放弃这些手段各国在反恐时就会显得束手束脚。

sentences.english: The ship bilge and they didn't know what to do.
sentences.chinese: 船底漏水了，他们束手无措。

sentences.english: Q. Berdych was having some problem with your slice and change of speed.
sentences.chinese: 贝尔蒂奇对你的削球和速度变化束手无策。

sentences.english: Tne new code baffled the enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 这套新密码使敌特机关束手无策。

sentences.english: He lives only by his pen and could do nothing when running into a problem.
sentences.chinese: 他光会耍笔杆，碰到实际问题就束手无策。

sentences.english: Mu Zhixiao of one's proper business, not dare defy, be seized without fighting.
sentences.chinese: 正事母至孝，不敢违抗，束手就擒。

sentences.english: The new code baffled the enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 这套新密码使敌特机关束手无策。

sentences.english: And anti-pollution measures and regulations are falling far short of getting to grips with it.
sentences.chinese: 而反污染措施及规章则鞭长莫及，束手无策。

sentences.english: And if the keypad is metal, fuhgeddaboudit.
sentences.chinese: 如果是金属键盘，那就束手无策了。

sentences.english: So then, is it only having our hands tied to wait for it?
sentences.chinese: 那么我们只有束手等待它吗？

definition: to be taken prisoner
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
to extend one's neck in preparation for execution (idiom)
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
to deal with (an offender)
to rush indiscriminately into action
to withdraw
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
to bend one's head
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
ashen-faced (idiom)
to kneel and beg forgiveness
to keep silent (idiom)
to keep quiet out of fear (idiom)
to wait for (orders, a decision, a judgment)
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
